str2: All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To be sitting, sit down, be seated. From kata and the base of hedraios; to sit down.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A council, tribunal; the Sanhedrin, the meeting place of the Sanhedrin.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To direct my gaze, look steadily. From a compound of a and teino; to gaze intently.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From pros and ops; the front, i.e. The countenance, aspect, appearance, surface; by implication, presence, person.
As if, as it were, like; with numbers: about. From hos and ei; as if.
From pros and ops; the front, i.e. The countenance, aspect, appearance, surface; by implication, presence, person.
From aggello; a messenger; especially an 'angel'; by implication, a pastor.
